title: Teen left bedbound for two years after ingrown hair left gaping hole in back
text:
Chae Ruffold, 15, has been unable to sit or stand after he developed a pilonidal sinus (Picture: Michelle Ruffold / Caters News)

A teenager has been bedbound for two years after an ingrown hair became infected, leaving a fist-sized hole in his back.

Chae Ruffold, 15, has been unable to sit or stand since he developed a pilonidal sinus, a condition that left him with a painful open wound at the base of his spine after the tunnel in his skin became infected.

The once outgoing young man’s life has completely changed and he is now reliant on a cocktail of painkillers and antibiotics and confined to his bed 24/7.

His sinus became infected after he developed an ingrown hair.

He was diagnosed with a pilonidal sinus in January 2018 after he had a small operation on his toenail and doctors noticed something wasn’t right.

Seven months later, the wound had become so big that his mum Michelle claims a person’s fist could have easily fit in it.

Chae had to undergo surgery after the sinus spread 7cm up his spine and 5cm across his back.

Chae’s whole life has been changed by his condition and he is in constant pain (Picture: Michelle Ruffold / Caters News)

But in August 2018, the family were told the sinus had returned, meaning Chae would be forced to go through a second round of surgery.

Now, the sinus has returned for a third time and gets ‘bigger by the day’.

His devastated parents Michelle, 43, and Carl, 49, are raising £5,000 for their son to have an operation that will remove the infected tissue and allow the wound to heal.

Michelle, who organises family meals around Chae’s bedside because he can’t get to the dinner table, has named the situation ‘a living nightmare’.

She said: ‘It’s been nothing short of a living nightmare.

‘There are days when Chae gets really down and frustrated. He can’t get out of bed and can be in huge pain sometimes.

‘It can be very upsetting when he gets in a low mood because it’s very hard for him to think positively.

The gaping hole in his back could easily have fit a fist in it, says mum Michelle (Picture: Michelle Ruffold/Caters News)

‘He’s a social butterfly and an outgoing boy. He should be out playing with his mates not lying in bed all day.’

Chae, from Eastbourne, East Sussex, said: ‘I’m in pain all the time and I’m fed up with it all.

‘I just want to get on with my life.’

Michele said: ‘The wound is getting bigger by the day, it’s rotting him away very gradually.

‘We need this surgery otherwise it will get worse, it’ll allow him to start healing again.

‘We haven’t been able to sit around the table and eat for two years.

‘We can’t go out, we can’t do anything as a family, we haven’t been able to go on holiday.

‘You have to keep your spirits up and stay positive and just keep upbeat.

‘He’s in pain every day, he has to take cocktails of adult painkillers, they make him quite drowsy and not himself.

‘It’s just heartbreaking to see.’

You can help the family raise money for Chae’s surgery on GoFundMe.

description: Chae Ruffold has been bedbound for two years after he developed pilonidal sinus, which left him with an open wound at the base of his spine.
